revised_title: Anatomical Study of the Dentate Body in the Cerebellum
tldr: The author, William Brinton, investigates the dentate body of the cerebellum and its anatomical structure. He concludes that the dentate body forms a tubular investment around the extremity of the processus e cerebello ad testem, connected with the opposite body by a commissure of grey matter. Its interior receives fibres of the cerebro-cerebellar peduncle, while its exterior radiates fibres to various lobes of the cerebellum.
